revised_title: Reptilian Remains from the Trias of Elgin: A Study of Skull Structure and Classification
tldr: This article describes various reptilian remains found in Triassic sandstone quarries at Lossiemouth, near Elgin. The author, G. A. Boulenger, examines the skull structure of these reptiles and discusses their classification within the Rhynchosauridae family. The study also highlights the differences and similarities between these reptiles and other groups such as Sphenodon, Dinosaurs, and Thecodontia.
